x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Electronic waste (e-waste) is the fastest-growing waste stream globally, often improperly disposed of, leading to toxic contamination and loss of valuable rare earth metals. There is a lack of an organized, single-platform system to connect consumers/businesses wanting to recycle with certified processors and repair centers.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The solution is a centralized platform to manage the complete lifecycle of electronic assets, from disposal to reuse/recycling:

  • IT Asset Management (ITAM): To register and track assets (e.g., phones, laptops, batteries) marked for recycling/disposal and manage inventory of recovered components.
  • Field Service Management (FSM): To schedule and route pickup requests from businesses and consumers efficiently to minimize collection costs and carbon footprint.
  • Service Bridge: To connect asset owners (customers) with certified third-party recycling/repair vendors (providers) seamlessly on the platform.
  • Performance Analytics: To track key metrics like e-waste diverted from landfills (by weight) and materials recovered to prove environmental impact.
